posts.post_content:
Run sacrifice creatures to counter burn spells.
  
Dont attack if they have 2 or more power on the board.
  
Possible to give him cheap flying/unblockable to bypass blockers.
  
   
   
   
   
This is the kind of drawback that makes you think how to wield the power. Baneslayer and Obliterator take the thinking out of the equation.
posts.html:

New Phyrexia seems to have improved on the negator with [Phyrexian Obliterator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Obliterator).  
  
The cost may be very color intensive, ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol), but what you get is... disturbing.  
Same body, but move the sacrifice effect from you to your opponent.

posts.post_content:
After reading all the comments, i'm going to assume that some of you have not been playing him in the right deck. I run him in a black/white deck that also includes: [Vindicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vindicate), [Cruel Edict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cruel Edict), [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Swords to Plowshares) and the very powerful (if not super unfair) [Balance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Balance ) . the Negator is powerful you just have to give him the right support and play on his weakness. I feed mine [Phyrexian Walker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Walker)'s he just loves the crunch and if you get tired of the pain just [Culling The Weak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Culling The Weak) him to somthing like [Desolation Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Desolation Angel).  
  
[Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual)/Balance for the win 4.5/5 stars  
  
 (yeah burn decks can cause problems)  
+ I hate this art version
posts.html:
After reading all the comments, i'm going to assume that some of you have not been playing him in the right deck. I run him in a black/white deck that also includes: Vindicate, Cruel Edict, Swords to Plowshares and the very powerful (if not super unfair) Balance . the Negator is powerful you just have to give him the right support and play on his weakness. I feed mine Phyrexian Walker's he just loves the crunch and if you get tired of the pain just Culling The Weak him to somthing like Desolation Angel.

Dark Ritual/Balance for the win 4.5/5 stars

(yeah burn decks can cause problems)
+ I hate this art version
